actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1350.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance, S. Rept. 94-1346.

official_title: A bill to provide for the income tax treatment of amounts received on the sale of property the cost of which was deducted as a business expense.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1350) Amends the Internal Revenue Code to require that in cases of gain from the disposition of property acquired after December 31, 1975, any portion of whose purchase price was deducted as a business expense, such amount so deducted shall be treated as allowed for depreciation.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the income tax treatment of amounts received on the sale of property the cost of which was deducted as a business expense.
